1.rationale:
Let's plan the next move. Last turn's logic seems sound in aiming for the (2,6) apple, and the proposed path to get there looks reasonable. 

However, upon reviewing again, I notice the snake has quite a long body stretched across the right side of the board. If I maintain that length, moving directly left up and up will be quite a zigzag. 

An alternative path could be to head right to (9,7) first, then up to (9,6), and from there directly to the (2,6) apple. This would be a more straightforward line, reducing the risk of collision with myself or the wall, especially if I don't intent to grow this turn.

Keeping an eye on the opponent's movements is also crucial. If the red snake starts moving towards the right, I might need to adjust my path again to avoid collision or scrambling for a different apple.

Okay, considering these factors, I think the revised, more linear path to the (2,6) apple is a good choice for this turn.
